definition: easy to remember
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
the palest ink is better than the best memory (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 ji4 xing4 bu4 ru2 lan4 bi3 tou2

sentences.english: This catchy jingle is successful in attracting a lot of consumers.
sentences.chinese: 這首簡單好記的廣告歌成功地吸引了許多消費者。

sentences.english: I wanted something short and memorable – it had to be Ali.
sentences.chinese: 我想要簡短好記的，就用“阿莉”了。

sentences.english: Make sure our slogan is catchy and memorable.
sentences.chinese: 記得，咱們的口號需要是既上口又好記。

sentences.english: Do you have the cords you use on a regular basis in a place that is easily accessible and well marked?
sentences.chinese: 你有適合日常使用而且容易拿到並且好記的線頭嗎？

sentences.english: We shall now show that the change of variable formula for integrals is just as unforgettable.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在來說明積分的換元公式也一樣好記。

definition: lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to spend (money or time)
Jyutping, one of the many Cantonese romanization systems/abbr. of 粵語拼音|粤语拼音[Yue4 yu3 Pin1 yin1]
to talk nonsense/nonsense!
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
conversation/CL:個|个[ge4],次[ci4]
offal/mixed entrails/trivial matters
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
to bear grudges
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
